etymologies: early 17th century (in the sense ‘ancient history’): from modern Latin archaeologia, from Greek arkhaiologia ‘ancient history’, from arkhaios ‘ancient’. The current sense dates from the mid 19th century

definitions: the study of human history and prehistory through the excavation of sites and the analysis of artifacts and other physical remains.
shortDefinitions: study of human history and prehistory through excavation of sites
